ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This was a challenging but incredibly rewarding learning experience. It required that I developed my work ethic further and maintain self-discipline by setting deadlines for myself given that the class did not meet at a regular time. Writing my senior thesis also strengthened by research, argumentative and writing skills in a focused manner driven by my personal interest and autonomy in choosing the topic.

The senior essay project challenged me to think critically as I composed a research question, identified historical source material, and crafted a structured narrative that responded to my original question. I learned to conduct historical research; identify and describe historical themes of science, medicine, and indigeneity; and integrate academic knowledge with lived experiences to synthesize an analytical essay that tracked the changes in a specific phenomenon over time.

I learned how to design and execute an independent research project. I learned how to consult a variety of academic literatures and how to synthesize this information and craft arguments responding to these literatures.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course does an excellent job of guiding students through every level of the research process; from asking question, to writing, to developing structure, to conducting interviews, and to editing.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! This is a great way to take on a topic of your interest into much more depth than you'd normally be able to in a normal seminar. It also allows you to pace yourself by pursuing a year-long senior thesis and to produce a piece of work that is specific to your personal interest.
